greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for n>1, a(n) = the largest prime divisor of the number C(n) formed from the concatenation of 1,2,3,... up to n.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..56 [First 50 terms from Zak Seidov]
mathematica: a = {}; b = {}; Do[w = RealDigits[n]; w = First[w]; Do[AppendTo[a, w[[k]]], {k, 1, Length[w]}]; p = FromDigits[a]; AppendTo[b, First[Last[FactorInteger[p]]]], {n, 1, 25}]; b (* _Artur Jasinski_, Apr 04 2008 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Sep 01 2002
